item.description:
The board game for business studies.

In Teen-Trepreneur students choose to run one of six businesses in the game and are given the challenge of leading it to business success! Each business is different in terms of its opening value and start-up capital; each entrepreneur has a personality and business background that will also affect the chances of success.

The objective for students is to be the first to achieve £5,000 profit. They’ll only do that if they take risks and manage sales and costs effectively. Students can run a luxurious hotel or an everyday market stall. They can even invest in the businesses run by other players!

The game contains features such as: generating sales, expenses, the stock market, investment, opening businesses abroad, loans and interest. It helps raise a young person’s understanding about how a business is started and how a business is being run in today’s world.

Players roll and move on a board, answering spelling and word-definition questions to advance. The player that reaches one of the final spaces and correctly answers that final challenge is the winner.

There are three colors on the board corresponding to "cowardly" (yellow), "bold" (blue), and "superhuman" (red) levels of word difficulty (plus black spaces, which end a player's turn immediately). A player landing on a colored space must correctly spell AND define a word from a card corresponding to that color. If a player does both, they may roll (2 dice) and advance again to answer another challenge. If they get one part wrong, they must roll 1 die and move backward that amount (and their turn ends). If they get both wrong, they must roll 2 dice and move backward that amount (and their turn ends).

Tailath is a cross between TAIJI and Yavalath, that can be played with a Cross set (7x7x7 hexhex board and pieces in 2 colors) or a OMEGA set (setting up the board to 7x7x7).

It was generated by a human searching the game space.

RULES:

Each player has an allocated color (red or blue).

On your turn, you must place one red piece and one blue piece adjacent to each other on any 2 adjacent free spaces on the board.

You win by making 4 in a row of your color at the end of your turn, but you lose if you make 4 in a row of your opponent's color (even if you make 4 in a row of your color).

The player in turn also loses if he cannot make a legal move.

DESIGN:

TAIJI was created by a human (NÃ©stor Romeral AndrÃ©s), and Yavalath was created by a computer program (LUDI, by Cameron Browne).

One day TAIJI and Yavalath just drank too much and...

item.description:
[yellow tail]-opoly is marketing/promotional board game released by Casella Wines, who produce [yellow tail] wine. It is a wine-themed derivative of Monopoly and is similar to Wineopoly in many respects. From the game's own description:

"Buy and trade your favourite [yellow tail] wines, build your own winery and discover the little wine brand that could. Learn as you play! Each deed contains information and great Roo facts about our wines and winery. Test your [yellow tail] knowledge. Do you know how to make a [yellow tail] BUBBLES sangria? Grab another card and you could be sharing a glass with our Managing Director -- John Casella. The winery is still 100% family owned with three generations currently involved. Play by your rules because it's all about having fun! Be careful not to be sent to the WINE CELLAR -- you may never get out! So choose your token and advance to CHEERS! Who knows...you could be elected president of the [yellow tail] games club!!!"

From USAopoly.com:

It’s time to get things started! So let’s get on with the show!

Celebrate the sensational, inspirational world of The Muppets as you make like Miss Piggy and try to own it all in this Muppets Collector’s Edition of Monopoly. Here’s your chance to buy, sell and trade treasured Muppets properties such as Kermit’s Swamp, Miss Piggy’s Dressing Room and Fozzie Bear’s Comedy Club. Six collectible tokens including Miss Piggy, Kermit, Fozzie Bear, Animal, Gonzo and the Swedish Chef make this a cherished collector’s item for Muppet fans of all ages.

From USAopoly.com:

Drop the puck. It’s game time!

What Blackhawks fan hasn’t dreamed of owning and running their favorite NHL® team – the Chicago Blackhawks®? The NHL and the Monopoly game have teamed up to put an exciting new spin on America’s favorite board game. Buy, sell and trade the most popular players and team assets in a quest to own them all. Wheel and deal Jonathan Toews, Patrick Kane, Duncan Keith, the United Center, and even the 2010 Stanley Cup® victory in an effort to own and control the 4-time Stanley Cup champions, the Chicago Blackhawks!

Put your game face on and get ready to hit the ice!

Game comes complete with six custom tokens; Hockey Puck, Zamboni® Machine, Skates, Forward, Goalie and Stanley Cup® Trophy.

name.value: Monopoly: Night Sky Solar System Edition

item.description:
From USAopoly.com:

Bring the wonders of the solar system into your living room with this special Night Sky Solar System Edition of the Monopoly game. Halleys Comet, Jupiter, Earth and the Moon are all up for grabs as you buy, sell and trade popular celestial bodies in your quest to own the universe. Six collectible tokens include a telescope, the Mars Rover, observatory dome, binoculars, a radio telescope and the Hubble space telescope. A planetary delight that’s out of this world for astronomy enthusiasts of all ages.

From LateForTheSky.com:

STURDY, FRIENDLY, CURIOUS, HAPPY-GO-LUCKY... MEET THE BEAGLE!

The sturdy and merry little Beagle is one of the most popular dogs in the United States. A member of the Hound Group, Beagles are scent hounds, developed primarily for tracking game. Since they lived in packs for hundreds of years, they naturally enjoy the company of other dogs and humans. Beagles are intelligent, but as a result of being bred for the long chase are single-minded and determined, which can make them hard to train. Despite this, their happy-go-lucky nature and gentle disposition make them a wonderful family pet.

BEAGLE-OPOLY IS A GAME OF TAIL-WAGGING FUN!
COLLECT YOUR FAVORITE BEAGLES AND PLAY HARD!

Increase your rent by buying Toys for your dogs and upgrading them to Big Bones. Sounds easy enough until you get fleas, have an accident on the carpet, or worse yet, get sent to the kennel!

GRAB YOUR TOKEN AND ADVANCE TO GO BEAGLES!

Who knows! You may soon be Best in Show... or marching in the Dog Parade! Whatever happens, keep your wag on!

GRACEFUL, INTELLIGENT, CHEERFUL, ATHLETIC...
MEET THE BOSTON!

Boston Terriers have strong, friendly personalities. They are highly intelligent, energetic, happy-go-lucky dogs that literally live for their human companions. They are very popular in the United States, due above all to their excellent character. With patience and assertiveness, Boston’s are easily trained and will become a cherished member of any family.

Boston-opoly is a game of tail-wagging fun! Collect your favorite Bostons and play hard!

Increase your rent by buying Toys for your dogs and upgrading them to Big Bones. Sounds easy enough until you get fleas, have an accident on the carpet, or worse yet, get sent to the Kennel!

Grab your token and advance to GO Bostons! Who knows! You may soon be Best in Show... or hanging out by the fire hydrant!

BRAVE, COURAGEOUS, LOYAL, FUN-LOVING CLOWN... MEET THE BOXER!

A Boxer is all that is good in a dog! Developed in the late 19th century in Germany to act as a guard and companion, the Boxer has carried these traits admirably through its history. While they are certainly boisterous by nature, their intelligence is up there with the best of them. They fit easily into family life and thrive on being one of the "pack". Devoted and fearless, Boxers have an endless capacity to give love!

GENTLE, COURAGEOUS, DEVOTED, AFFECTIONATE... MEET THE BULLDOG!

Known for their loose-jointed, shuffling gait and massive, short-faced head, the bulldog is a sweet tempered family companion. A medium-sized dog, they are not your typical lap dog, but would like to be! Said to have originated in the British Isles, the name "bull" was applied because of the dog’s connection with bull baiting. Bullheaded and determined, this breed can be very persistent. They do not give up easily. Bulldogs are very much a peoples’ dog, seeking out human attention and loving every bit they can get!

item.description:
From LateForTheSky.com:

SMALL, INTELLIGENT, SASSY
MEET THE CHIHUAHUA!

The smallest breed of dog, the Chihuahua, is named after the state of Chihuahua in Mexico. Their history is shrouded in mystery but some believe they originated from the Fennec Fox, a very small animal with big eyes and ears, which could explain the tiny frame, colossal eyes and ample ears of today’s breed. Graceful and alert with a saucy expression; Chihuahuas are highly intelligent, courageous, extremely lively, proud and adventurous. The Chihuahua is a wonderful little dog but don’t underestimate them based on size!

item.description:
From the Press release at launch, Eezee Kricket is "The Teaching Learning Game."

It is a fairly simple roll-and-move game where the player moves his pawn around an 8x8 grid, following the instructions on the given square. If the square shows that the batsman is out, then the player must answer a trivia question - if he fails to answer correctly, then he is out, but if he gets it right, he continues.

The trivia questions are all cricket based, specifically pertaining to cricket in the West Indies and require at least an interest in West Indian cricket to be able to have a chance of getting them right.

Transport management card game of the future!

1. Compete for better contracts to service city transportation needs. 
2. Manage your transportation network using busses trains or airplanes. 
3. Choose between different fuel types to find the best balance between making profit and fuel payments. 
4. Bribe politicians and choose your benefits from the government.
5. Finally trade with stocks, to get extra profit and better discounts from different companies.

Game contents
Game rules;4 Quick rules cards; 6 City cards; 36 Vehicle cards; 3 Stock market cards;1 Fuel price card;1 Turn sequence card; 30 Political cards 
30 Stock cards;18 Sell company shares cards

Game progress.
Use “Turn Sequence” to keep track of the game progress. Game starts with a politics round and continues one turn at a time.
Game lasts total of three rounds.

Turn sequence
To determine player sequence, start with politics turn. Bet to bribe ministers and choose new laws, to give your company the edge over your competitors. Next turn is "Stock market", starting with the player, who did not bribe any ministers. Buy/sell two stocks at a time. Continue with “Vehicle market” turn, starting from highest bribed minister, buy different fuel type vehicles, that are linked with cities, find best combinations, for bigger profit. Next round all players gather profit from their transportation networks and stocs NOTE: Starting from every “politics” turn players will receive three “sell company shares” cards to make some extra cash. Shares can be sold to the bank any time and cannot be bought back.

End of the game:
A player with the most amount of victory points wins the game, 
Points are rewarded for:
Vehicles 
Stocks 
Every 1m in cash 
Bribed ministers during last round
Points are reduced for every "sell company shares" card used.

From LateForTheSky.com:

PROUD, CLEVER, AFFECTIONATE, AMUSING... MEET THE DACHSHUND!

The Dachshund is a lively breed with a friendly personality and a keen sense of smell. Known for their long and low bodies, they are one of the most popular dog breeds. The name "dachshund" is of German origin and literally means "badger dog", from Dachs "badger" and Hund "dog". First bred in the early 1600’s in Germany, the breed became popular in the U.S. during the early 1900’s. They are loveable, playful companions, and an ideal pet for many homes!

The German Shepherd is hailed as the world’s leading police, guard, and military dog, but there is so much more to this outstanding dog. Originating in 1899 in Germany, the breed first gained international recognition at the decline of World War I. Later, the fame associated with Rin-Tin-Tin and Strongheart shot the popularity of the German Shepherd sky-high. A loving family companion, herder and show competitor, the German Shepherd is one of the most popular breeds in the world.

GENTLE, INTELLIGENT, FRIENDLY, EAGER TO PLEASE
MEET THE GOLDEN!

With good reason, the Golden Retriever is one of the most popular breeds in the United States. They are loveable, well-mannered dogs with great charm and a striking golden coat, making them both beautiful and a joy to own. Originating in the Scottish Highlands in the late 1800s the Golden was used predominantly for hunting. Active and energetic, this breed can adapt to many different living situations but requires daily exercise. They are easily trained, always patient and gentle with children, and make wonderful canine companions.

GENTLE, INTELLIGENT, FAMILY-FRIENDLY... MEET THE LABRADOR RETRIEVER!

"Labs", as they are affectionately known, are the most popular dog breed in the world. Originally from Newfoundland, Labs worked alongside fishermen and were bred primarily to perform as efficient retrievers of game. They have great desire to please, a characteristic that allows them to excel as guide dogs and in law enforcement. Kind to children, friendly to people and other animals, energetic, Labs will play fetch for hours or lie quietly on the family room floor as a pillow for the kids.

GRACEFUL, INTELLIGENT, CHEERFUL, ATHLETIC... MEET THE POODLE!

The poodle is regarded as the second most intelligent breed of dog. They come in toy, miniature, and standard sizes with many coat colors. The breed originated in Germany as a water retriever and the English word "poodle" comes from the German word "pudel", meaning to splash in the water. They like to be in the center of things and are easily trained to do astonishing tricks involving both brains and agility. Known as a "people dog", the Poodle is a "person" and expects to be treated as one! Each one is a character and for that reason they make wonderful, unique companions.

item.description:
From LateForTheSky.com:

STRONG WILLED, PLAYFUL, LOVING... MEET THE PUG!

The Pug is well described by the phrase "multum in parvo" which means "a lot of dog in a small space". They are appreciated for their playful personalities, their outgoing, loving dispositions and their even tempers. The Pug is one of the oldest breeds of dogs and has flourished since before 400 BC. China is the earliest known source for Pugs, where they were pets of the Buddhist monasteries in Tibet. Highly intelligent, they can be a bit willful if they sense they are stronger minded than their human companions. The Pug’s reason for living is to be near their people and to please them, and their personalities make them a family favorite.

LIVELY, ALERT, FRIENDLY... MEET THE SHIH TZU!

The ancestors of today’s Shih Tzu breed are among the most ancient of dog breeds. These dogs were cherished by Chinese royals as prized house pets for over a thousand years. The word Shih Tzu means "lion" and although this dog is sweet and playful it is not afraid to stand up for itself. The traditional long silky, glossy coat that reaches the floor requires daily brushing to avoid tangles. Often the coat is clipped short to simplify care. Happy and hardy and packed with character, the gentle and loyal Shih Tzu offers a lot of dog in a small package.

FRIENDLY, LOYAL, STRONG-WILLED, ENERGETIC,
MEET THE WESTIE!

With BIG personality, the West Highland Terrier is a bold and energetic little dog with absolutely no idea of its true size! More commonly called the "Westie", the breed is known for its friendly, strong-willed character and remarkably bright white coat. Westies were bred in Scotland and used to seek and dig out foxes and badgers. They love their two-legged companions and are generally willing to please them... as long as they think it’s a good idea! To be fair, this is a dog bred for tenacity and if dealt with firmly and lovingly, a Westie makes an affectionate addition to any family.

The Yorkshire Terrier offers a big dog in a small package! Affectionately known as "Yorkies", these energetic pooches are one of the most popular dog breeds in the world. They are truly unique in both their diminutive stature and their big personalities. But don’t let their small size fool you; they are terrific watchdogs and have the attitude of a full sized dog when it comes to protecting their homes and families.

link.value: Late for the Sky Production Company

item.description:
Analyze Me is filled with humorous, revealing, and intriguing questions all designed to help you get to know your family and friends a little better, and become the next graduate of the Shrink Academy.

On your turn, you ask a question from 1 of 4 categories: Work Life, Private Life, Social Life, and Play Life. The other players submit a card facedown indicating their answer (either A, B or C). As you peer into their minds and hearts, try to guess their true personality and preferences. Guess who answered what correctly and you win the category card. The first player to collect 1 of each category card wins the game!

Whether you go down as one of the worst shrinks in history or become a master of the couch, Analyze Me will lead to lively discussions, a few secrets, and hopefully a little honesty as your opponents become confidants.

item.description:
Artists, doodlers, and armchair critics alike will love Sketch It. With paper and pencil ready, draw a card and roll the die. Ready, set, sketch it!

Each card lists six items. The number rolled tells you what you will sketch. Each person will sketch a different item, and do so all at the same time. Draw fast so you can grab the higher-valued tokens – but don't draw too fast or you'll stump your opponent. In Sketch it, you score points two ways: when the player who received your drawing guesses what you've drawn, and when you can figure out the masterpiece you received.

After ten rounds, the one with the most points wins! You're either the best artist, the best decipherer, a little of both, or maybe just the luckiest. No matter how it ends, players will sketch, laugh, and try to outsmart each other down to the nub.

Arrange colorful cubes in different designs with Pixy Cubes. Each cube is colored green, red, yellow, and blue either as solids, halves, or in two variations of crescent shapes. You can race for speed, challenge your memory, or simply create pictures and designs as a pastime.

In the speed game, players try to be the first one to arrange their cubes in a pattern designated on a Challenge Card. In the memory game, players have ten seconds to memorize the pattern, then try to be the first one to duplicate it.

Pixy Cubes also contains Design Cards that players can use as a layout. Some cards show the sides of the cubes while others are plain. The levels of difficulty vary. With or without the models, the possibilities are just about endless!

item.description:
In Spell it!, one player rolls the five alphabet dice each round, then everyone tries to think of a word that uses three of the five letters in a word that fits the theme. The themes include: "Home Sweet Home", "Around the World", "Famous People", "Sports, Games, and Hobbies", "Create a Theme" and "No Nouns".

If you call out a word that matches the theme, you win a chip equal to the total number of letters used in that word.

item.description:
Dungeon World is a rules system designed to allow players to use 10mm Pendraken Miniatures to conduct old school dungeon crawl adventures using heroes to battle terrible Monsters in the deep, dark places of the World.

These rules are for fantasy skirmish war gamers who like the idea of taking up table top gaming, but lack either the space to play a larger scale game, or who are reluctant to spend a king`s ransom collecting 28mm heroes and monsters. Larger scale dungeon games tend to look rather flat and slightly abstract, unless the collector is prepared to put in a vast amount of time and energy to make the game stand out above the norm. Well, with 10mm miniatures you can not only play highly satisfactory skirmish games on the size of a small coffee table, but you can also buy your entire resin dungeon and a complete collection of miniatures for far less money than it might normally cost you to purchase even one fantasy army using the larger scale miniatures made by most mainstream game companies.

A game by Stephen A Gilbert.

Philippe Keyaerts scored gold with Small World, a new version of his Vinci that was released by Days of Wonder in 2009 to great acclaim and numerous awards. With Olympos, coming from French publisher Ystari Games, Keyaerts has another go at the simplified civilization game. The playing time for Olympos is only 60-90 minutes for 3-5 players, but says Ystari's Cyril Demaegd, "Even if it's a short game, it's a gamer's game."

Players take actions based on their position on a time track, along the lines of Peter Prinz' Thebes. (Says Demaegd, "This is mainly a coincidence because Philippe designed this game years ago.") By spending time, players take actions, with the choices being expansion or development. Expanding brings new settlers onto the game board, which depicts Greece and Atlantis, which lets you conquer territories and thereby acquire resources.

Development takes place on the game's discovery board, with players either buying new scientific discoveries – such as medicine or phalanxes – or building architectural wonders. Each discovery brings you new powers, such as an upgrade in military strength due to the phalanx, and each wonder earns you points.

A player's piety is measured by discoveries, and the most pious player might be rewarded during the game by one of the nine gods included. Similarly, the less pious players might be punished by those same gods.

The replayability of Olympos is huge, says Demaegd, as the discovery board and gods in play will be different each game, not to mention the territories you're able to conquer.

item.description:
You are an Eternal Legend, a warrior who has the ability to take on at least a hundred men and survive. A hero who has fought many battles and come back with trophies, gold and many tales to tell.

Such heroes and heroines of adventure and wonder travel the land to seek their own destiny and fortune. Yet there is only one true way to gain such fame and that is on the field of battle. Any hero can go down into a dark dungeon or save a maiden from a tower, but it takes a true hero to fight alongside fellow men and outshine every one of them.

Eternal Legend is a hack and slash adventure where you play one hero or heroine who has to cleave their way through years of war in order for their name to go down in history. Every turn a card is drawn and the player can choose to fight in that war or pass it by. If they pass they begin to fade into obscurity but if they succeed the Hero gains more riches and fame.

As the years go on the world gets harsher, new wars are fought and less is understood. Can your hero survive all eight eras of battle or will their name go down in just a few sections of history?

Play one hero or compete for fame with friends as you cleave your way war by war, becoming the victor or dying a (hopefully) heroic death. The objective is to claim fame in as many wars as possible and amount the largest pile of gold and riches before your inevitable defeat. Everyone dies someday, so why not go out in a shower of bloody but heroic glory.

Object of the Game
 To spin the dreidel longer than your opponent. "Longer" pertaining to the length of the time the dreidel spins from the release to the finish Time of Spin (TOS), from the moment the dreidel leave your fingers to the moment it comes to a complete rest on its side. The referee (an impartial judge who is not spinning in the match) is the only one who wil keep track of a spinner's TOS with the sanctioned MLD Spinometer.

The Spin Zones are located in the middle of the Spinagogue. They are the designated "spinning areas", the only place on the spinagogue a player is permitted to spin. A player can never intentionally spin the dreidel outside of the Spin Zone. For MLD tournament play the Spin Zone decreases in size as rounds progress, usually every two rounds in "head-to-head" play depending on your bracket and every round in a "total spin tournament". The Spinagogue comes with two separate spin Zones, when placed inside of the Spinagogue comes with two separate Spin Zones, when placed inside of the Spinagogue they decrease a player's spinning area, making spinning conditions more difficult.
 There are 3 more variations of play using different MLD Game Terrains (inserts): Spinnings, Target Tops & Hardwood Court.

name.value: Gramo The Grammar Game of Skill and Chance

item.description:
60 grammar terms and their descriptions are the basis of this Bingo-type 'educational' game. Each player gets one of 40 'GRAMO' cards, a 5 by 5 grid where each square has a grammar term number and it's description. The caller randomly pulls from the stock of 60 tokens, and reads aloud the column letter (G, R, A, M, or O), a grammar term, and optionally, that term's number. If that term's description is on his or her card, a player marks that square with a translucent disk, hoping to be the first to get five in a row. Can be played in three difficulty levels:

1) Playing by the numbers. The caller reads the column letter, term, and term number. This makes the game no harder than Bingo with some grammar terms thrown in.

2) Playing by the book. The caller omits the term number, but players have access to a "Epi/Gramo" booklet in which they can find the terms and descriptions.

3) Playing for mastery. Players no longer have access to the book and have to recall from memory all terms and their description.

A player calls "Gramo" when he or she covers five squares in a row on his or her card, and once verified is declared the winner.

Develop a nimble mind by computing basic multiplication facts or, inversely, breaking products down into factors and possibly prime factors. In the game, players use two spinners to generate numbers, and have cards that track the results of the spins, depending on the game.

In Product Capture, players claim the product of two factors they spin. Three or more chips in a row earn points keyed to the color zones.

In Factor Pursuit, players compute the product of two spinners and mark any set of factors for this product on their scorecards. Be the first to fill your scorecard and win! A bonus investigation guides students in exploring the multiplication table for repeating, reflecting, and growing patterns

Jungle Jive! The Eggciting Balancing Game!

Jungle Jive! is a party game in which players challenge themselves and others to see who has the best balance, flexibility, coordination and concentration.

Players take turns drawing challenge cards (rated from easy to hard) describing a stretching, balancing or turning exercise the player must perform while holding an electronic egg. If the egg is tipped off-balance during the player's turn, the sleeping baby bird inside will awake and start laughing! The player will then receive no points for that turn. If the baby bird sleeps through the exercise, that player moves their token forward one space. The first player to complete 5 exercises without waking the bird is the winner!

Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

item.description:
Amateurs to Arms! is a historical simulation game of the War of 1812. One player assumes the role of the British (including Canadian) forces, and the other plays the Americans. This often-overlooked conflict ended in a draw historically, but this was not the only possible outcome. The Americans clearly wished to annex Canada to their young nation, while the British wanted to teach their former colonies a lesson. The game includes all of the theaters of battle from the war: the US/ Canadian border and the Great Lakes (of course) but also the wilderness of the old Northwest, the Atlantic coast of the US, the Civilized Indians of the south, and the site of the final conflict at New Orleans.

Each turn represents a few months of time (depending on the season). A typical turn consists of dealing out to each player the number of cards indicated on the turn track. The winter and spring turns require a few special tasks. The Americans will have more resources to commit to the war- until Napoleon is defeated in Europe, and the English player can focus more resources on their efforts in North America. Each card can be played for the event described on the card, or for the card’s Operations Points, to move Expeditions, build ships and fortifications, or raise troops.

Events on the cards and on the map will cause the markers on the Peace Track to move forward. This represents the war weariness of each side’s people: bad events will cause your people to demand peace. Most events push inexorably towards peace; only a few rally your people for a longer war. When the two markers meet on the Peace Track, the game proceeds to the negotiations at Ghent, and the winner is determined. Oh yes, and then each player plays one more card, while news of the peace travels across the Atlantic!

item.description:
Balancing/dexterity game for 2, 3 or 4.

Players in turn place weights over pegs on a five-armed structure balancing on a central pivot. A weight placed too far out along an arm causes the structure to overbalance, costing the player points. As the game progresses and more weights are placed on the arms of the structure, it is possible to place weights at the end of the arms.

There are three different scoring mechanisms that can be used within the game, allowing for a certain degree of strategy to be employed.

name.value: The 19th Hole Classic Golf Card Game

item.description:
From the box cover:

Golfers
Get your favorite foursome together and discover the fantastic entertainment in eighteen holes of golf, played with cards.

Played using cards, each player is dealt a hand of cards representing the number of strokes scored for a given hole. Each player chooses the card that they want for each hole, with the winner of each hole playing last on the next hole. Play continues in this fashion until 18 holes have been completed; the player who won the most holes wins the game.

Edited description from Bruno Faidutti's write-up of the game in his Ideal Game Library:

Skull & Roses is the quintessence of bluffing, a game in which everything is played in the players' heads. Each player plays a face-down card, then each player in turn adds one more card – until someone feels safe enough to state that he can turn a number of cards face up and get only roses. Other players can then overbid him, saying they can turn even more cards face up. The highest bidder must then turn that number of cards face up, starting with his own. If he shows only roses, he wins; if he reveals a skull, he loses, placing one of his cards out of play. Two successful challenges wins the game. Skull & Roses is not a game of luck; it's a game of poker face and meeting eyes.

Skull & Roses Red features the same gameplay as Skull & Roses, with the only change being alternate rules that allow each player to control two biker gangs. Both Skull & Roses Red and Skull are playable on their own, with each game containing six different biker gangs. Each Skull or Skull & Roses set can be combined with another to allow for games with more than six players.

item.description: In the game, each player takes a role as a web developer who works on a team to set a new blog by implementing the WordPress engine. Each player need to set the optimal combination of plugins. It sounds easy, right? But there are some elements on the game that will make that simple task much more challenging. There are 3 dices that represent the request from the boss that the player must obey – some time those will destroy all the work. When to cooperate and when to compete is another challenge that each player need to solve.

Blocked aboard a spaceship fleeing the Earth, some of your companions contracted the strange disease which ravaged the humanity. The "Spore" takes the control of people who then become "mutants". Find these persons ! Look after them or kill them before being contaminated in turn. Unless it is too late and you are already one of them, leading the others to their loss.

Sporz is an easy game to set up. The players cooperate to find who is contaminated.
But be careful: Each player may secretly change camp and betray his original teammates. Novice and experienced players can play together. The victory of a team comes through successful communication, trust, and a good dose of bluff.

The game is highly inspired from Werewolf games, the essential differences are that players usually change team during play, rather than being killed, and that discussions are not public: People must interact one-on-one.

There is a game master, the Computer, who organizes the game.
At the beginning, each player gets one secret role.
Each round is alternatively Day and Night.
There are 2 teams: Healthy and Mutant.

Mutants act during the night and can do two actions each night (2 actions for the entire team):

 Mutate a healthy character (unless he's resistant).
 OR Kill another character.
 AND Paralyze another character in order to skip his turn.




During the night, other roles can also act (such as the Psychologist or the Computer Scientist, who guesses the current number of mutants).

During the day, everybody can talk and secretly vote in order to execute 1 character. Yet, if blank votes have majority no one dies.
The game ends when all survivors belong to only one team.

item.description:
On 22nd January 1944, Allied forces landed at Anzio, a small coastal town just 30 miles south of Rome. This attack behind enemy lines, was intended to unhinge the German fortified Gustav Line.

The Germans responded quickly, containing the beachhead. The fighting was bitter, with both sides suffering high casualties. Intense artillery bombardments, water filled trenches and muddy conditions, made this battlefield a wretched place. The Allies would be on their beachhead for four long months before they were able to breakout and meet up with the rest of U.S. 5th Army.

The game represents the first six weeks of this campaign. It was a period when both sides attacked each other vigorously, looking for opportunities to break through the enemy defences, while desperately resisting enemy advances. By the beginning of March, both sides had fought each other to a standstill.

The Anzio rules bring differential based combat, single stacks attacking single stacks, Random Events, random strength Allied bombardments, historically based special abilities for some formations, anti tank values, bog checks for off road movement and disengagement tests when attempting to leave an enemy ZOC.

The presentation includes Large hexes and large counters to enhance the playing experience. The counters are provided on self adhesive paper and require the user to mount them onto card prior to cutting.

Place eight number cards around the dice rolling bubble (Flippy). Press down on Flippy, let go, and watch him flip and roll the dice for you! Claim a card that matches the number on either die or their total. Easy-to-learn, fast-paced fun for the whole family!

name.value: Pass the Pigs: Pig Party Edition

item.description:
Pass the Pigs, in which players roll pig-shaped dice to score points, included one pair of pig dice. Deluxe Pass the Pigs doubled the swine count, with two pairs of pigs for head-to-head competition. Now Pass the Pigs: Pig Party Edition has brought home the bacon, doubling the pig count yet again with four pairs of pigs (pink, black, brown, tan) included in the box.

Game play is reminiscent of Pass The Pigs, but with more pigs and more scoring opportunities. Players try to win cards that display a specific goal (pigs in a particular orientation) and a point value. The game includes bonus cards, including a chance to roll all eight pigs at once. Sooooooo-eeeee!

Pass the Pigs: Pig Party Edition comes with a black, zip-up case to hold the game components.

item.description:
Classic themes or offset, a handful of dice and letters. Shake well, discover the theme and the letters of words to find and respond as quickly as possible!

At the beginning of the game, choose a card with 6 themes. At each turn, a player rolls a die defining the topic and then a color dice and dice marked with letters. The color dice determines the first letter of the word to find (in agreement with the assigned topic). The players play together and are entitled to one proposal per round. They earn as many chips as found in letters from the word found. Depending on the number of players, the last or the last 2 participants were not allowed to speak. If the color dice falls on the black face, one player can make a proposal. He must find a word does not include any letters learned. He won 4 chips if the word is correct and if it loses 4 proposal includes a letter from.

The game ends when there are no more chips in reserve. The player who has the most wins.

Much of this taken from the French here :
http://fr.asmodee.com/ressources/jeux_versions/djam.php



Des thèmes classiques ou décalés, une poignée de dés et des lettres. Agitez bien, découvrez le thème et les lettres des mots à trouver et répondez aussi vite que possible !Au début de la partie, on choisit une carte comprenant 6 thèmes. À chaque tour, un joueur lance un dé définissant le thème, puis un dé de couleurs et des dés marqués de lettres. Le dé de couleurs détermine la première lettre du mot à trouver (en accord avec le thème imposé). Les joueurs jouent en même temps et ont droit à une seule proposition par tour. Ils gagnent autant de jetons que de lettres tirées présentes dans le mot trouvé. Selon le nombre de joueurs, le dernier ou les 2 derniers participants n’ont pas le droit de parler. Si le dé de couleur tombe sur la face noire, un seul joueur peut faire une proposition. Il doit trouver un mot ne comprenant aucune des lettres tirées. Il remporte 4 jetons si son mot est correct et en perd 4 si sa proposition comporte une des lettres tirées.

La partie se termine quand il n’y a plus de jetons en réserve. Le joueur qui en possède le plus l’emporte.

item.description:
Tietovisa oluen ystäville. 
Quiz-type Boardgame for beer enthusiastics.

Game includes a board with a trail of different types of beer with The Start spot and the Goal.

The game includes only the board and the Question cards. No playing pieces for the players are included, but the players are instructed to use bottle caps, small coins and/or anything they find from theyr pockets as the playing pieces

During a players/teams turn they answer a question presented to them by a opposing player/team from a question card that includes 2 different questions (the question asked is determined randomly)
On wrong answer they have to take one Step back and on right answer 3 forward. If the Question card includes a picture of the beer where the players piece was originally then they are awarded with one additional step forward , the first one to reach the goal is the winner

item.description:
A Miniatures Game of Massive Robotic Mayhem

Iron Tyrants is a tabletop miniatures game of massive robotic combat. Each player will field a squad of tyrants, giant walking robots armed to the teeth with cannons, rockets, and lasers in an attempt to dominate the battlefield and crush his opponent under his metal heel. Sometimes, victory may mean simply being the last player with tyrants left standing, but a variety of scenarios are provided featuring a range of victory conditions so that every game is a completely different experience.

A full campaign is also included. The campaign will have players fighting for one of three factions over control of Gateworld Atropos and the future of the Allyrian Sector. Rules are included for the variety of environs on the gateworld such that the gateworld's weather and conditons bring the battlefield to life.

The system is d10-based and features several areas of resource management leading players to balance risks versus rewards with nearly every decision on the table. The key behind this is the Overload mechanic in which a tyrant may be pushed well beyond its normal capabilities but at great risk to both the machine and the pilot. Players also have a limited supply of Tactics Dice which are used both in determining initiative and in activating special abilities provided by unique commanders. Gameplay is filled with difficult decisions in which every choice has a consequence.

The game was intended to be played on a tabletop filled with terrain but hexmaps may also be used without issue. All game measurements are made from a 1-inch round base so units may be represented by any appropriate miniature. In the very near future we will be releasing printable miniatures for each tyrant in the game.

It's a game about tough choices. It's a game about resource management. Most importantly, it's a game about giant robots blasting the hell out of each other across the torn landscape of the future.

This is a racing game, freely inspired by the egiptian game of Senet.

The aim of the game is to bring all you pieces to the other side of the 30-spaces board; the piece move according to the dice throw: with 2,3,4,6 you can chose to move one piece of that amount. With 1 you move one piece of 1 space but can repeat the turn. With 5 you move ALL your pieces of 1 space. Spaces already occupied by own pieces can never be reached. Opponent pieces can instead be captured or jumped, unless they are in groups of 2 or 3 respectively.

From the box:
Who will be the first to bring his beetle to the finish line ?
A fun tactical contest....with a little bit of luck.

Educational game where up to four players have to develop the territory of Catalonia (Spain) by establishing industries and equipments.

The players alternate taking turns moving their tokens around the board and building the different industries, buildings, and equipments.

Each player can choose among four different building strategies, each having its different Victory Points chart. At the end of the game, the player with more VPs wins.

Now all of Count Hogarth's children have come of age it is time for them to prove themselves independently. The Count has given each of them a small sum of his fortune to invest in building their own settlement.

The settlements must be filled with pleasure, be plentiful and ruled with an iron fist of power. Without all of these elements it will not be exquisite and if it is anything less than exquisite you will be banished, deep within the cellars of the Count's castle never to return again.

Only one child shall be the Count's future successor and you better make sure that it is you.

Exquisite rivalry is an auction game of 3 to 4 players based in a medieval setting. Players compete to bid on different elements to improve their town. The winner of each round getting first pick of the cards and the loser collecting the most gold in return.

The winner is the player who has managed to gain the highest majority in two out of the three elements required to impress Count Hogarth: Pleasure, Plenty and Power

An abstract game for two players. Each player gets square and triangle pieces in two colors, and must alternately place pieces on the board so that they touch a piece of the other color and do not touch pieces of the same color. The player with the smallest total area of remaining pieces wins.

Manchester City Football Club version of Monopoly. In place of the traditional properties there are current and previous players, as well as football-themed playing pieces.

From the publisher:
Throughout Manchester City’s proud history, the club has built a deep, lasting kinship with their fans - following City can be a rollercoaster of dizzying highs and emotional lows, and this special edition of Monopoly commemorates those who have contributed to the club’s glorious heritage.

A children's spin-and-move game in which players move pieces representing four characters from the show in a race to find the doll Mrs. Beasley, which is pictured on one of eight face-down tiles scattered on the gameboard.

name.value: Monopoly: Blackpool & the Fylde Coast Edition

item.description:
Version of Monopoly based around Blackpool and the Fylde Coast. The traditional properties are replaced by locations including the Illuminations, the Winter Gardens and the Blackpool Tower.

From the publisher:
The historic town of Blackpool finds its home in this new edition of Monopoly! The classic board game moves away from Mayfair and Old Kent Road and onto the famous streets of Blackpool, with all its attractions.

Make or Break starts with 60 marbles in 4 colors randomly distributed on a grid. On a turn, a player rolls 4 special dice and swaps marbles of any opposing colors rolled with marbles of their color. The object is to create rows of at least 5 marbles of one's own color. Any rows created are scored immediately, and the game continues until someone reaches 1000 points.

A version of the pencil-and-paper game Boxes, modified to allow (1) play by 2 to 4 players, and (2) a spinner that can dictate the number of segments the player must play or even their orientation (horizontal or vertical). Once the fourth segment of a square is played, the player claims that square by placing a dot of his or her color in its center and then plays again; the winner is the player who has claimed the most squares by the end of the game.

item.description:
In Myriad, each player has a board and a set of letter chips. The chips are placed on the boards to form words, with the score per letter being the number of letters in the word. Unusual features of the game include:


 After playing a word to their own board, a player may place their letters on other players' boards to form words. Each player with letters in a word scores for them.



 When a word is formed that contains shorter words (e.g., KIN which contains IN), the shorter words are scored as well.



 The center section of each board can be rotated to put the letters in different positions.


Several levels of alternative rules are provided for children.

The game was sold in two and four-player sets.

A variation on Candy Land, in which the players draw cards to move to the nearest square of that color as they advance towards the goal. Differing from Along the way, they may draw a card inviting all players to a party being held at specially-marked squares on the path.

This is a trivia game centered on the world of gossip and celebrities, with questions from the past and present that must be answered by the players in order to be the first to reach the GOAL square, and answer "The Challenge".
The game play consist in the roll of two dice, first one for moving through the board, and then another to choose from the four questions in the card. With a result of five in the second die the person questioning chooses one of the four, and with a six you move to the next space of the board, and your turn ends. 
If you fail the question, you normally have to move backwards several squares, and if you answer correctly you move forwards some squares. How many spaces you move will depend of the type of square you land on with the roll of the first die. (there are five different, and then the GOAL square)
The Challenge consists on answering correctly three of the four questions of one card. If you do it, victory is yours!

Simple statistical game on tennis, being an adaptation of the system pionereed in Olympic Tennis.
Each player is rated for Service and Return, plus his ability to win Tie Break and be more decisive than his/her opponent in the hotter phases of each match. 
As almost all statistical sport game, is better suited for solitaire gaming and you may complete a match in a matter of minutes, as the score is calculated game after game.

From LateForTheSky.com:

Located in Lubbock, Texas Tech University® is a major comprehensive research institution rich in tradition, athletics, and heart. Raiderland is a place where students explore their interests, discover their passions and realize their potential. Ask students or alumni, there’s nothing quite like the Red Raider spirit!


Looking for a fun way to experience
TEXAS TECH UNIVERSITY®? Here it is!
All the fun... none of the studying!

Choose your token and advance to GO RED RAIDERS! Collect credit hours and
trade them in for diplomas. You may soon be marching in the Goin’ Band of Raiderland... or bumming quarters to do your laundry!

link.value: Late for the Sky Production Company

item.description:
From LateForTheSky.com:

A board game about the GREAT city of Wichita!
We chose some favorite landmarks and traditions, mixed in some airplanes, Native American heritage, a beautiful western landscape, and some BIG FUN...
and voilà behold; WICHITA-OPOLY!
Grab Some Friends and Gather 'Round!

Here's a quick idea of how to play!
Buy property, collect City Blocks and trade in for a Key to the City. It sounds easy enough - but add in a traffic jam, property taxes, parking tickets and the IRS and it becomes a little more difficult... and a lot more FUN!

link.value: Late for the Sky Production Company

item.description:
From LateForTheSky.com:

We chose some favorite landmarks and traditions, mixed in some cherry blossoms, great parks, a few festivals, the arts, some BIG FUN... and voilà behold; Washington-OPOLY!

Grab Some Friends and Gather 'Round!

Here's a quick idea of how to play!
Buy property, collect City Blocks and trade in for a Key to the City. It sounds easy enough - but add in a traffic jam, property taxes, parking tickets and the IRS and it becomes a little more difficult... and a lot more FUN!

A board game about the GREAT city of Topeka!
We chose some favorite landmarks and traditions, mixed in some hot air balloons, sunflowers, a great big motorsports facility, and some BIG FUN... and voilà behold; Topeka-OPOLY!

Grab Some Friends and Gather 'Round!

Here's a quick idea of how to play!
Buy property, collect City Blocks and trade in for a Key to the City. It sounds easy enough - but add in a traffic jam, property taxes, parking tickets and the IRS and it becomes a little more difficult... and a lot more FUN!

link.value: Late for the Sky Production Company

item.description:
From LateForTheSky.com:

It’s impossible to include everything, but we jammed all the HOUSTON we could into this box. It’s filled with sports, art, breathtaking parks, space technology, and a bayou or two! Looking for a fun way to experience Space City? Here it is!

Here’s a quick idea of how to play!

Buy your favorite HOUSTON properties, increase your rent by collecting city blocks and trading them in for keys to the city. Sound easy? Well, add in some traffic jams and parking fines and it gets a little more difficult and a lot more fun! So choose your token and advance to Go HOUSTON! You may soon be running for mayor... or lost in outer space!

link.value: Late for the Sky Production Company

It’s impossible to include everything, but we jammed all the
Cleveland we could into this box. It’s filled with sports, music, dog bones, buzzards - a little something for every Clevelander!
Looking for a fun way to experience C-Town? Here it is!

Here’s a quick idea of how to play!

Buy your favorite Cleveland properties, increase your rent by collecting city blocks and trading them in for keys to the city. Sound easy? Well, add in some traffic jams and parking fines and it gets a little more difficult and a lot more fun! So choose your token and advance to Go Cleveland! You may soon be running for mayor... or migrating with the buzzards!

link.value: Late for the Sky Production Company

item.description:
From LateForTheSky.com:

While it’s impossible to include everything, we jammed all the Charleston we could into this box. From Sweetgrass Baskets to the Charleston Harbor and all the charm in between, here’s a fun way to experience Charleston, South Carolina!

HERE’S A QUICK IDEA OF HOW TO PLAY...

Buy your favorite Charleston Properties, increase your rent by collecting City Blocks and trading them in for Keys to the City. Sound easy? Well, add in some traffic jams, property tax and parking fines and it gets a little more difficult and a lot more fun!

So choose your token and advance to Go Charleston! You may soon be the mayor of Charleston... Or you may end up in the City Jail!

It’s impossible to include everything, but we jammed all the FORT WORTH we could into this box. It’s filled with old west flare, stunning art, Texas hospitality, Honky-Tonk, and a Cattle Drive or two! Looking for a fun way to experience Cowtown? Here it is!
Here’s a quick idea of how to play!

Buy your favorite FORT WORTH properties, increase your rent by collecting city blocks and trading them in for keys to the city. Sound easy? Well, add in some traffic jams and parking fines and it gets a little more difficult and a lot more fun! So choose your token and advance to Go FORT WORTH! You may soon be running for mayor... or lost in
The Cowtown Cattlepen Maze!

link.value: Late for the Sky Production Company

item.description:
From LateForTheSky.com:

How do you make a game about a place like this?

While it’s impossible to include everything, we jammed all the Portland we could into this box. From a park too small for one person to the magnificent Mt. Hood backdrop and all the eclectic wonder in between, this is beautiful Portland, Oregon!

Here’s a quick idea of how to play...

Buy your favorite PORTLAND properties, increase your rent by collecting city blocks and trading them in for keys to the city. Sound easy? Well, add in some traffic jams and parking fines and it gets a little more difficult and a lot more fun!

So choose our token and advance to taxi! You may soon be
the mayor of Portland... or you may be summiting Mt. Hood!

link.value: Late for the Sky Production Company

item.description: Version of the board game Monopoly, with the traditional properties replaced with locations from the Isle of Wight including The Needles, the Isle of Wight Festival and Osbourne House which was Queen Victoria's residence on the island.
Version of Monopoly using locations such as Ben Nevis and Loch Ness from the Highlands and Islands of Scotland in place of the traditional properties.

3D "marble run" game. Each turn, the player gets three marbles (small steel balls) and throw them into several holes at the top of the ramd-like hill. in a random manner, each of them starts running downhill through a system of 3D tracks or keeps stuck. The players` figures are racing up a serpentine path up the hill, crossing the marbles` courses, and the number of steps they move depend on how many marbles are stopped by them. If a figure lands on a special kind of space, a mechanism at the top of the hill is activated and all marbles, which got stuck so far, are released at once and run downhill. If there are too many marbles in front of a figure, it has to go back.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

item.description:
Carrier based starfighter combat.

Fighter-Tac is a deeply strategic card game for two players. Each player is in command of a massive warship called a Battle-Carrier, and each uses a customized deck of cards called the Flight-Deck. The goal of the game is to use your Fighters and other cards in your Flight-Deck to destroy your opponent's Battle-Carrier, before he or she destroys yours.

Gameplay consists of drawing cards from your Flight-Deck on your turn, then spending Resource Cards (Fuel, Energy and Ammo) to launch Fighters and shoot their weapons in an attemp to destroy the opponents Battle-Carrier. The Flight-Deck also contains other cards to aid in the fight, such as Skill Patches for your pilots, Refits for your Fighters, Modules that upgrade your Carrier, and even Support ships to increase your firepower or defense. Resources must spent to play these other cards as well.

There are various kinds of Fighters at your disposal: Interceptors, Assault Fighters and Bombers are just a few. Each has their own strengths and weaknesses. Knowing when to attack with which Fighter is vital to winning the game.

Using your Resources, dice rolls, and other cards in your deck, your goal is to get your Fighters across the Combat Zone to the opponent's Battle-Carrier so they can make attack runs in an attempt to destroy it. Your opponent will send out Fighters to try to intercept and destroy yours as well. Any of your Fighters that make it through will be able to attempt an attack run on the enemy Battle-Carrier. Each Battle-Carrier has a limited amount of Armor Points. Once the enemy Battle-Carrier's Armor Points are depleted, it is destroyed and you win!

A combination of deck construction, Fighter tactics, and using your Resource Cards wisely is the key to victory. Resources can give a Fighter or a Pilot strengths and abilities that can win the day over the enemy. They can also be used to make your Battle-Carrier more efficient and deadly as well, thus increasing its chances for survival, and increasing your chances to win the game.

name.value: Monopoly: 2010 Fifa World Cup South Africa Edition

item.description: Version of Monopoly themed on the 2010 Fifa World Cup, including competing nations in place of the traditional coloured property sets, stadia in place of the stations and half time/full time cards instead of the chance/community chest cards.

Version of Monopoly which replaces the traditional properties with players from Fulham FC past and present.

From the publisher's website:
A must for all Fulham fans, this new edition of Monopoly features current stars alongside the legends of the past, and is your chance to find out just who is the hottest property at the club!

Put together your own dream team by buying and selling players as you try to bankrupt your opponents.

Now's your chance to snap up the likes of Andy Johnson, Johnny Haynes, Alan Mullery, George Cohen and even Mohamed Al Fayed himself, as well as the famous stands of Craven Cottage as you race round the board and to victory!
